message: http://www.ozpolitic.com/funny/photos/expand.jpg
nice
What's the purpose of this thing?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HSKyHmjyrkA
Oh right. Like Campfire sort of. Let's see what it does to media
A bit like a real-time Quora
Start a new group!
This could use an export feature for topics
I don't know that this has any benefit over Campfire. So far it seems very similar
It seems like a tech that has yet to find its best purpose
I reckon Marlena would like it for her Weekend testing sessions
Much better than Skype
It seems like the kind of place that you could create a sort of pseudo-official forum-type experience for your users
What do you guys think the benefits of this are over Campfire?
So, designers and developers could help each other out in semi-realtime and we could monitor it and contribute where it makes sense
Github are using it to get feedback on new features and improvements they're working on
Yeah
Yeah might be easy for customers to join since it links to Twitter
I think the outreach-to-customers element has potential
Plus it persists and is searchable as a kind of documentation
Agreed
Not sure that real-time chat support is something you'd necessarily want to get into though
I can imagine it being useful when there are more groups
Heck no, I'm sending her the link. I'm doing whatever I can to not become the new WTANZ person ;)
